intro: Gahnia psittacorum f. leucosperma, commonly known as the white-headed gahnia, is a variant of the gahnia plant native to Australia. It is a perennial grass-like plant that belongs to the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its upright, spike-like inflorescences. The foliage is typically dark green, and the inflorescence of this form is distinguished by its white or pale yellow bracts. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in swampy or seasonally flooded areas. The plant plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
